utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Do you see them anywhere?

utterance.speaker: Fang Dong Wen
utterance.content: Why don't we go back to their house, wait for them there.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Yeah, 'cause they'll probably answer the door the sixteenth time I knock. There they are. Hi. I'm sorry I followed you here. I just really wish you could give me a few minutes of your time. I know you never agreed to make it an open adoption, but I just figured maybe you never had a choice. I mean, it's China, right?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: W — what did he say?

utterance.speaker: Fang Dong Wen
utterance.content: He wants you to leave them alone.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Please. I just want ten minutes. Learn what you're like, tell you about my life.

utterance.speaker: Fang Dong Wen
utterance.content: He said they have no daughter. I am sorry you wasted a trip.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I know that's them. How does that work? How do I pray?

utterance.speaker: Fang Dong Wen
utterance.content: You make a wish and lift the Buddha.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I wish they could understand how badly I need this.

utterance.speaker: Fang Dong Wen
utterance.content: Now make the wish again. If you cannot lift the Buddha this time, your wish will be granted.

utterance.speaker: Fang Dong Wen
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I picked Cameron’s pocket down in ER. I came up with a doozy.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Your mother called — twice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's still healthy. This 25-year-old woman, on the other hand…

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Her messages sounded kind of urgent.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, that's the way women sound when their spouse of 50 years dies.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Your dad died? Are you —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yep. Fine! Our patient, who's been known to take a few drinks on non-occasions, vomits blood and collapses on a trip to China. Chinese surgeons cut out a foot of bowel, but the pain is worse now than it was before.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House, call your mom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are you, my mom?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We can continue this differential in five minutes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are those bags under your eyes? You were up all night. You told her, didn't you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't know what your daddy issues are, but don't deflect them on me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Told his wife he's been getting some strange. She kicked his adulterous tuchus to the curb.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Seriously, you told her?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes, I told her. But no, she did not kick me to the curb. We stayed up late talking. We're going to continue talking. Much like House should be doing with his mother right now.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Anybody read Chinese? Otherwise, we have no idea what these doctors did to her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kutner, you're sort of Asian, right? Get it translated.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What about Meckel's diverticulum? If the surgeons didn't remove the diverticulum, it can cause pain, bleeding.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Too high up for a colonoscopy. CT could miss it. Ultrasound's fastest. And since I'm fastest with the ultrasound…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, let me do the ultrasound. You need to deal with your dad and stop —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not deflecting because I'm avoiding something deep. I'm deflecting because I'm avoiding something shallow. Seriously, I'm fine. I didn't even like the man.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No Meckel’s. Were you there for the rice or the reeducation camps?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I was there to track down my biological parents.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like a salmon returning to the stream where it was born. Did you become whole again, or did you get eaten by bears?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: They denied my existence.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Four parents, and not one of them taught you to cover your mouth.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh, my God! It looks like they cut you in half.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Doctor, we're her parents.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm just a technician. Her doctors will be by later. You can schmooze then.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Can you let them know that we, uh, we went by her apartment and collected all her medication.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm a technician and a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: You went through my apartment?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: We found alcohol. We thought you'd quit.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Did her drinking cause this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Can you tell her it did?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Licorice root.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Uh, no, thanks. I'm good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I threw it to you for a reason. That's what the Chinese doctors gave her. It contains glycyrrhizin.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: They were treating her for… SARS?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not very effectively. But SARS explains the cough, causes hypoperfusion, which explains the ischemic bowel. It's perfect.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Lung involvement isn't very severe.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, well, so call it "ARS." Start her on ribavirin and interferon.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Sorry about your father.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not. Are we done emoting now?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: If there's anything I can do, just —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, you're right. I don't think I can sleep alone tonight. And you can tell me that that is liquid Vicodin.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We're giving IG shots to everyone who came in contact with your patient. Shockingly, none of the nurses volunteered to administer yours. It goes better in a large muscle. Drop your pants.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, I usually pay tens of dollars to hear that.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The funeral's tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My mom called you?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: There is a 3:40 flight out of Newark. If you leave now, you can be in Lexington tonight. Your mother wants you to deliver a eulogy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Eulogy," from the Greek for "good word." Now, if she asked me to deliver a bastardogy, I'd be happy to —

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then be a grown-up. Call your mother back and tell her that you're sick with grief, but you're too busy to be there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She knows when I'm lying.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then start writing.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: They yanked my brother and sister out of college. Can you please tell them I'm not dying?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You have SARS. I'm wearing a mask. It's a big deal. Cut 'em some slack.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: But I am gonna be okay, right?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: That's what all this stuff is for. We're gonna need the names and numbers of everyone you came in contact with here and in China. Flight numbers, dates…

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: That doctor that I coughed all over… Is he gonna be all right?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: So far he's fine.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Oh, oooh. It's back. This is where the pain all started.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She's tachycardic. Get a crash cart in here!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: What's going on? I need to know what's going on. That's my daughter.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Her liver's failing. It's not SARS.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I am not doing this because I care.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cuddy drugged me. She… My mom didn't call Cuddy. She called you. I knew you couldn't stay away. I knew you loved me too much.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm doing this for your mom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not doing this at all. If there were something to be done, I would have done it in the year he spent dying. You took my Vicodin? I'm in pain. One? So the Vicodin is my leash. One'll take the edge off, but it won't give me enough relief for an escape back to Plainsboro.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where's my phone? It's the team. It's their ring tone. Forget it. The patient's blood is on your hands.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House? You there?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm being held against my will. Call the police!

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Nicole had a clot in the hepatic vein. Chase sucked it out, saved her liver.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: No signs of a tumor or venous malformations. Nothing that could cause —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She's an addict.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Drugs and alcohol wouldn't —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She's a smoker. Combine smoking with any one of a dozen genetic disorders, and she's a clotting machine.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Multiple blood clots would tie together bowel ischemia, lungs, and the liver.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need to pinpoint which defect she has so we can start her on the right anticoagulant. Draw her blood. Let's find out which genetic gift her genetic parents gave her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thanks for calling. My ring tone for you is "Dancing Queen," by Abba.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Nicole?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need to pee. Pull over at the next stop. I'll just pee on the floor. You bought used floor mats? That is brilliant.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: There's a rest stop in five miles.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cane.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The restroom's right there. You can make it on your own.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I suppose I could talk about the summer he decided he wasn't speaking to me. Two months, not one word. Anything he wanted to say, he typed up and slipped under my bedroom door.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You don't want to say anything, don't say anything, but go. Tell your mom you're sad for her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just by being there, I’d be lying.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She wants to think, for a moment, that she had a happy family. So give her a gift — lie!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Give me my cane, I'll go to the damn funeral.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I said I'd go to the funeral. I didn't say when.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: We have these two categories: Inside and outside. Patients stay inside. Then, when they're better, we let them go outside.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Thanks. But they don't let you smoke inside. So why don't you go back there and give me five minutes outside?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Make a fist. Such a beautiful day, we thought we'd do all our doctoring outside.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: People stare at me any time I'm out with my family. It's like a puzzle. "Which one of these things doesn't belong?"

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Belonging's overrated. I was adopted by a white family when I was nine. I like being different. The view's better from the outside looking in.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Must be easier to be different when you're a success. Is that a problem?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: This is why we prefer inside.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You actually keep a flashlight that doesn't need batteries in the trunk? Next to the jacket, emergency water, nail clippers, tooth brush, space blanket —

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: When things go wrong, I like to be ready. Will you… please hold the flashlight for a minute?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You know, those aren't just my car keys. My house keys are on there too. Amber gave me that key chain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, she didn’t. Not unless your pet name for her was "Volvo." A man who would lie about a gift from a dead girlfriend…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Is probably responding to a childish, pointless act of petulance.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The struggle to resist one's captors is never pointless. Vive la résistance!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, I hate to break it to you, Che, but simple delay won't work. Your mother will hold the funeral till we get there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My father was a punctual man, beholden to time. Two minutes late for dinner, you didn't eat. My mother would never disrespect him by starting the funeral late.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, you clearly have no issues to work through.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on, forget the keys. Call a locksmith. We'll go inside and play "guess that smell" with the truckers while we're waiting. Join me on the dark side.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The dark side's done, House. I'm delivering you to your mother, and that's it. I’ve moved on.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What do you think House would send, the "gentle comfort" arrangement or the "warm thoughts" bouquet? I mean, if he wasn't an ass.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Send one of those giant cookies shaped like a coffin. His mom would believe it was from him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I didn't tell you so you could send anything. Just wanted you to know the extent to which the man is disconnected from the human race.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Took a six-pack of FFP to stop the oozing.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She's bleeding and clotting?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Plus schistocytes on her smear means it's DIC, which means she's got cancer.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She's young. It could be leukemia.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Normal WBC makes that less likely.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The belly pain points toward a GI tumor.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: House already did an ultrasound.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He wasn't looking for a tumor. Go run a CT.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't buy it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: CT can find small intestinal cancers that an ultrasound —

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't buy House. When my father died, I wound up killing a patient. And I hated the man. Whatever House says or doesn't say, I'm sure the guy's a mess.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So he was a bastard. He was still your father. You're biologically programmed to have feelings for him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I'm not.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Feelings aren't rational. I know you have trouble with anything that can't be quantified and counted.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's not my biological father. I figured it out when I was 12.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Of course. You were a brilliant, socially isolated 12-year-old, and you create a parallel universe in which your life doesn't suck.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I look at the facts. First of all, he was deployed on training exercises off Okinawa during the time I had to be conceived.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And since you're 150 years old, air travel was impossible.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His second toe is longer than his big toe. Mine isn't.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This is sad. You don't believe your mother screwed around —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have a distinctive red birthmark on my scalp that matches a certain friend of the family.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you believed this story, you wouldn't be telling me about his birthmarks. You'd be telling me about the genetic testing you had done. And since you haven't mentioned it, obviously, you didn't do it. Because you don't want to — House, what are you doing? Get your — get off the — there's a cop!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Nicole, lie still. This'll only take a few seconds.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: One millimeter cut through upper abdomen.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She was adopted when the parents thought they couldn't have kids. Then they had three more. She took the message as "thanks for playing, but we have our real children now."

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And the real children probably think they're accidents while she was hand-picked. Everybody's got problems with their parents.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She's an addict. Something went wrong.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And it has to be the parents? Magnifying pancreas.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I'm not saying the parents screwed up.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're saying you like her. So you don't want her faults to be her fault. But they're someone's fault, and the only other people you know are —

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I think we may need to call House again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You lost track of your speed? I think that was Hitler’s excuse. Lost track of the Jews. No one held him responsible.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not playing, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were protecting me. Anybody in their right mind would have ratted me out.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm just trying to speed things along. You are going to this funeral.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Make it fast. I don't want to miss the anal cavity search.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Looks like a mass in the pancreas.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not to me. This is radio. And I want a full play-by-play.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's fluid-filled.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: Would you get out of the car, please, sir?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Officer, if you want to give me a ticket, I totally understand.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: Just get out of the car, sir.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cyst?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Large cyst. Something going on there?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson's getting arrested. How large? SUV sized, or mid-range sedan?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Seriously? What'd you do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm obviously joking. If Wilson was getting handcuffed on the hood of his car, would I be carrying on a differential?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Diameter is at least eight centimeters.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is it in the tail or in the head?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The head.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: You too, sir. Out of the car.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We've got a construction site. A steamroller is plowing —

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: Out now. No cane.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: James Evan Wilson, there's a warrant for your arrest in Louisiana.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: What are the traits of a steamroller? Powerful. Maybe pancreatic cancer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Great idea, except the only symptom it matches up with is being steamrollerish.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You don't think House is onto something?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I think he thought he had an idea. I also think his metaphors are tough enough to decipher after he's said them. We need to be focusing on the medicine.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No answer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There's not gonna be an answer. They've been arrested.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He was joking.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He reacted to the size and location. That's what we should be focusing on. Not playing Mad Libs while our patient's exploding noun destroys her life-sustaining noun.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll try to get Wilson on the line.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What if it's not how a steamroller works, but what it does? Clears things.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This is a waste of time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need that phone call. I'm a doctor, and when someone tries to call you three times, it's code for "pick up the damn phone before someone dies."

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: I'm sure there's other smart doctors.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You'd be surprised.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You told me you'd taken care of this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: First words you ever said to me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I took care of it. You must've screwed up somehow.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sir? Not to hurry you, but we need to be at a funeral in —

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: Nobody is going anywhere or taking any phone calls till I hear back from Louisiana.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's a really old warrant. Isn't there a statute of limitations on this kind of thing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's suspended when you flee the state.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I didn't flee the state. I left the state. Because I don't live in the state. And the charges were just so minor…

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: "Vandalism, destruction of property, assault."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: There is a simple explanation. There was a medical convention in New Orleans…

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: You don't need to explain to me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was fresh out of med school. I didn't know anybody at the convention.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You heard the man, Wilson. You don't have to explain.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I am not gonna sit here wasting time just so you can avoid your father's funeral!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's my father. I have the right to avoid his funeral.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: Not if your mother's alive, you don't. Okay… explain.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Did House react to the eight centimeters?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He whistled. It's huge. Anyone would think so.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House doesn't whistle because he's impressed. It means he wasn't expecting it. It means he changed his mind at that point.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A single super-sized cyst ruled out a diffuse process like scleroderma or lupus.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Rule out diffuse process, you're stuck with single process affecting just the pancreas.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Gallstones or pancreatic divisum.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Whatever he asked next would have narrowed that down.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He asked about location.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Heads it's gallstones, tails it's divisum.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's at the head. She's got gallstones.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: The steamroller means potholes —

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Relax. We got it.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You figured out she's got gallstones?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was at the hotel bar trying to unwind, have a drink. There was this guy who kept playing Billy Joel’s "Leave a Tender Moment Alone" on the jukebox.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: "Leave a Tender Moment" is a good song.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a great song. He was out of line.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: Not as good as "Scenes from an Italian restaurant" or

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So I — I asked the man to stop, politely.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, you yelled politely.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was polite the first couple of times, but courtesy made no impression on this ass. So I threw a bottle into the mirror, which successfully conveyed my message.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And smashed a ten-foot antique mirror. And set an example to two other patrons who threw shot glasses.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I had nothing to do with that fight. The assault charge was totally bogus. And I paid for the mirror.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: I think I have the picture. I assume you're the guy who was playing the song.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I was the guy who bailed him out.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's how we met. I was in jail.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: This guy was a total stranger to you, and you bailed him out?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was a boring convention. Had to have somebody to drink with.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And there's the foundation of our entire friendship. If you hadn't been bored one weekend, it wouldn't even exist.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, there were 3,000 people at that convention. You were the one I thought wasn't boring. That says something.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It also says something that you lied to me about getting the charges dropped!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I got a lawyer. He cut a deal. You didn't call the guy? You have to show up at the arraignment. Everybody knows that.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Everybody with your misdemeanor experience.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: You can go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What? He — he's a fugitive from justice. That whole story was lies. He stabbed a man.

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: Louisiana doesn't want to pay to get you back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Forget Louisiana. He was driving recklessly through your comatose village. Do they put lead in the jelly doughnuts here?

utterance.speaker: Costello
utterance.content: Stop acting like such an ingrate and go pay your respects to your father.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The CT confirmed gallstones. Normally not dangerous. Almost everyone has them. But sometimes…

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: They kill you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yup. Unless I take 'em out. We do it laparoscopically. Um… how long has her urine been brown?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Kidneys were fine this afternoon.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They're not now. It's not the gallstones.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, of course it's not gallstones. Who thought it was gallstones?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You said "steamroller."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I also said "construction site."

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Gallstones could cause a pancreatic cyst.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Will you just turn around. The thing is two hours over already, and that's the third time we passed that colonial with the cross burning out front.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not lost.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not talking about what caused the cyst. I'm talking about what the cyst caused. Everything.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Cysts are symptoms, not diagnoses.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unless it's a multiple cyst, with connections to other organs… like a steamroller.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's a long road down to the kidneys.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How do we prove it? Won't be visible in a scan. Chase isn't gonna go groping around when she's got kidney failure.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Bubbles.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that your new stripper name?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yes. And also, we inject bubbles into the cyst and follow where they drift. If they end up in the other organs, we know you're right, cut it out, she's fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bubbles is right. Go echo.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not lost.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Nicole, you gotta stay still.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I'm — I'm nervous.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You're not nervous. It's the DTs, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I haven't had a drink since I got here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Good heavens, we haven't missed it after all. It's like the end of a Christmas carol.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: I'm so glad you're here. Oh, it's a load off of my mind just to see you. Thank you, James.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mom, how could you delay the funeral?

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Honey, your dad is dead. He's not going to care. Do you know what you're going to say?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know. Just let the minister or one of his buddies from the corps…

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: You're talking. I don't care that you didn't like him. He was your father, and he loved you. The war is over, Greg. Please do this for me. Stop looking so worried. I know he's gonna make me proud.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm sure you know him better than I do.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Her liver's been compromised. And the DTS will cause her muscles to continue to twitch, even under sedation. We need to paralyze her to do this procedure.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I wanted to stop.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: A phenobarbital coma will not only allow us to inject the cyst, it'll treat the DTS. When she wakes up, she won't be in withdrawal.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: We've seen her through withdrawal before. We've seen her through everything. We've been supportive. We've been combative. We've picked her up from bars in the middle of the night. We've let her spend the night in jail.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I used to say it'd be okay. That I'd get it together. I don't say that anymore.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Let's make you healthy. Then we'll worry about making you sober.

utterance.speaker: Minister and mourners
utterance.content: The lord is my shepherd, I shall not want…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am not talking We were strangers who shared some geography 30 years ago.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Right, he had no influence on you at all. The father who was compulsive about punctuality.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His issue. Which I deliberately made not my issue.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Thereby making it your issue. Compulsively showing up four hours late, ignoring discipline, ignoring rules.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, God, he's here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Who's here? The one you're pretending is your father? Nice pick. He looks like Sean Connery. So back when you were devising this fantasy, did you tell your father: "Dad, I refuse to recognize your existence because I have chosen James Bond as my dad"?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I used different words.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What? Hearing that your own son hates you so much he's replaced you in his mind? That's gotta suck. How did he take it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I already told you. He didn't speak to me for a summer.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: It means more to me than — than I can say to have all of you here today. And now, uh, our son Gregory would like to say a few words. Greg?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's a lot of people here today. Including some from the corps. And I notice that every one of them is either my father's rank or higher. And that doesn't surprise me. Because, if the test of a man is how he treats those he has power over, it was a test my father failed. This man you're eager to pay homage to, he was incapable of admitting any point of view but his own. He punished failure, and he did not accept anything less than —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He loved doing what he did. He saw his work as some kind of… sacred calling. More important than any personal relationship. Maybe if he'd been a better father, I'd be a better son. But I am what I am because of him, for better or for worse. And I just — I just wish —

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Put it back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, he's not gonna miss it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm done enabling. You can't even let them put him in the ground without making it serve your agenda?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You really want to do this in front of everybody? You wanna punish me or them?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How can I still feel surprise? You would take, even this, a moment of real human grief, and turn it into a farce.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, cut the crap. You enjoy what I do. I never had to force you. You like coming along for the ride.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, that's why I'm cheering you on now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is about you needing to be prepared for the worst. So you become an oncologist. No surprises there. Worst happens all the time. But Amber, she was young and healthy. Her death came out of nowhere.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Don't bring Amber into this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you weren't ready. That makes you angry. The world sucks, and you didn't have time to brace yourself.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What happened out there is your show!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're scared to death of losing anyone that matters. So you dump the person who matters the most to you!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not scared to death. I'm moving forward!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because no one can take away from you what you no longer have.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, ho, ho, ho, ho. Your father's death is about you. Amber's death is about you. I can't imagine why someone wouldn't want to be your friend!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Admit it, you're angry and you're scared of losing me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not angry, I'm not scared.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Admit it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not afraid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Admit it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I've lost people. It happens.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Admit it. Admit it!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What are you, five? Stop repeating —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Admit it. Admit it. Admit it. Admit it. Admit it. Admit it. Admit it. Come on, admit it. Admit it!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Still not boring.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Did you know I was gonna do that? Because I didn't know I was gonna do that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know you have trouble losing people. In New Orleans, I saw you carrying this express package around the conference. And you wouldn't let it go, but you wouldn't open it. So I peeked at the return address.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Diamond, Fairbairn.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Divorce attorneys. Your first wife had just served you with papers.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Did you know that when you bailed me out? Were you… doing something nice for me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What did I say about being boring?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We owe your mom an apology.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hello? It's House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How'd the bubble test go?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The problem wasn't the cyst. It's advanced dilated cardiomyopathy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We did a three-dimensional echo. Showed a mass in the left atrium.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Looks like an atrial myxoma, but the ultrasound images are a little grainy, so it's hard to tell.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: House?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The images aren't grainy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: They sure look grainy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've seen pictures of you where you look tall. It's iron overload. Creates speckles on the image, makes it look grainy. Also makes her pancreas fail, her blood clot, and her intestine —

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Atrial myxoma is more likely.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: MRI for a better view. And call me back and tell me you're embarrassed because my eyesight is better 500 miles away. I need a phone number.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm a doctor in New Jersey, treating one of your clients. A young woman looking for her biological parents.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You know, you could just wait for the MRI to have your curiosity satisfied.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What person who is nothing like me are you saying that to?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did the parents look tan? The disease she has is genetic, which means they should have it too.

utterance.speaker: Fang Dong Wen
utterance.content: They don't look more tan than anyone else.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Discolored teeth?

utterance.speaker: Fang Dong Wen
utterance.content: They're farmers — the village doesn't even have a dentist.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Fang Dong Wen
utterance.content: But if it matters, I'm not convinced they were her parents.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Fang Dong Wen
utterance.content: Because they said they have no daughter. The man was adamant, and the woman seemed confused and frightened.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you. Differential. Say you're a middle-aged Chinese woman…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Say it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm a middle-aged Chinese woman.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Girl comes to you, says that she's your long-lost daughter. Why would you be frightened?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm frightened because she's a threat? Maybe she knows something?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She hasn't seen you since she was an infant.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Maybe an inheritance issue.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They're peasants.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Her very presence is a threat. She — what year was she born?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She's not supposed to be alive. China introduced the one-child policy in 1979. Say they didn't want a girl. They tried to kill her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe the baby doesn't die. Maybe the father panics or regrets it. Takes the baby to an orphanage. Maybe he doesn't tell his wife.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Who freaks out like she's seen a ghost 25 years later when the girl shows up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why does attempted murder from 25 years ago suddenly become relevant to her health now?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Maybe they gave her something toxic. It would have to be fat-soluble.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is fun, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let me see the MRI.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: We don't have one.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She started vomiting as soon as we started the scan.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then let her vomit through the MRI. That's what nurses are for. Her parents tried to kill her. I don't know how, but I know it caused her to get sick 25 years later trying to lift a Buddha. Explain. I already had this conversation with Wilson — just go with it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Poison?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Buddha wouldn't make it worse.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Maybe the weight stressed her back, which —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Makes sense if she's never lifted anything in her life.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She actually didn't get sick till she tried lifting it that second time. I'm guessing the weight changed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anybody have Taub’s pager number?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What's up?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe give him a call. If he tosses that switch on the MRI, she's dead. X-ray her brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pins. Push them through the soft fontanelle of an infant, you skewer the brain, and the hair hides the entry wounds. It's the perfect crime.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's had them in her all these years.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What changed at the temple?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Same thing that changed in the MRI. Shockingly, not all religious leaders are honest. I'm guessing these particular monks are bilking the faithful by pushing a magnet up Buddha’s butt. There's another one under the table that'll repel or attract, depending on how you shift them. When she picked up that magnet, it moved one of the pins deeper into the sympathetic nervous center of her brain. This sent a signal through the nerves to the blood vessels in her small intestine, which caused the symptoms in China and in the giant magnet we call an MRI. She's lucky. We're all screwed up by our parents. She's got documentation.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: The pins will be removed surgically, and she'll be fine. We'll wake her from the coma after the operation.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Is there any way you could not tell her?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Please. She's fragile. She desperately wanted to know her biological parents. For her to find out that they wanted her dead… I don't know what that'll do to her.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She may not be as fragile as you think.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: We know our daughter.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: See this pin here? It's been pressing directly on her addiction center. It's not her fault. And it's definitely not your fault. She's not who you think she is.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I hear your patient's gonna be all right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that why you're here? A colleague checking up on a patient?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Something goin' on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm celebrating. My mom hated him too.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your DNA test showed no match? That's incredible. At the age of 12, you actually figured out your father wasn't your birth father? That's what you wanted, wasn't it? Why should it depress you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It doesn't depress me. Doesn't make any difference at all. That's what depresses me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, I guess nobody gets to choose who their parents are. I'm not even sure anymore if we get to choose who our friends are. I spoke with Cuddy. She hasn't filled my position yet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you're coming back just because you're attracted to the shine of my neediness… I'd be okay with that.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm coming back because you're right. That strange, annoying trip we just took was the most fun I've had since Amber died.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You hungry? Wilson.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My dad's dead.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. My sympathies.
